results.title: Metamorphoses
results.creator_credit: Barry Greenwald, Faroun Films and Conestoga College
results.brief_description: A bored white collar office worker finds meaning in the 25 second elevator ride to his office. In this secret time alone, he progresses from simply undressing to his shorts (and then re-dressing) to a multitude of relaxing pass-times, all at ultrafast speed. One day the lift gets stuck and later opens to reveal a much older man apparently dead of old age. (Won Palm D’Or, Cannes, 1976.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Greenwald, Faroun Films and Conestoga College

results.title: Metals & plastics
results.brief_description: Looks at the history, properties, advantages and uses of plastics, and iron and its derivative steel. Examines how the properties of polymers from which plastics are built up affect their use.

results.title: Metals
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg shows the different properties of metals, illustrates their characteristics, demonstrates the crystalling structure of aluminium, and shows how the same piece of metal can have different properties according to treatment. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Metallurgist
results.creator_credit: Solarchrome, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Neville Bletcher
results.brief_description: Describes the work of a metallurgist and depicts various activities in which his skill is needed; in particular, the manufacture and testing of tin plate.

results.title: Metallica: Freeze 'Em All
results.brief_description: On December 8, 2013, Metallica created history by playing a show for fans and research scientists at the Carlini Argentine Base in Antarctica.

results.title: Metal of the centuries
results.brief_description: Documentary showing the uses of coper, brass, and bronze throughout history and across continents and the processing of copper from ore to its various finished forms such as copper alloys. Also shows the various industries that used the metal such as brewing and the motor and shipping industries.

results.title: Metal makers
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the mining and processing of copper, silver, lead and zinc at Mt. Isa, one of the world’s largest underground mines. Covers such aspects as the operation of the mine, mining techniques, mineral extractions and smelting, refining and distribution of the processed metal. Uses of the various metals are illustrated. Quality and pollution controls are also explained. The importance of Mt. Isa as a large inland city is also stressed.

results.title: Metal in harmony
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: Illustrates how aluminium is created, and indicates how much the metal is needed in the modern world. The basic raw material is mined in Ghana then shipped to Scotland, were hydro-electric power is available to create aluminium - a metal which is a skilful blend of ingredients.
